Beast tamers bring the wild to civilization, rearing and training creatures to follow their commands and perform flashy tricks that entertain audiences. **[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=14)): DC 19 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 17 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 14 [Beast Tamer](/NPCs.aspx?ID=942) **Source** [Gamemastery Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=22) pg. 237 **Perception** +12 **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Druidic](/Languages.aspx?ID=23) **Skills** [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +8, [Circus Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8) +6, [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=6) +8, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +8, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10) +12, [Performance](/Skills.aspx?ID=12) +8, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16) +10 **Str** +2 **Dex** +1 **Con** +2 **Int** +0 **Wis** +4 **Cha** +2 **Wild Empathy** The beast tamer can use [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=6) to [Make an Impression](/Actions.aspx?ID=50) on animals and to make very simple [Requests](/Actions.aspx?ID=51) of them. **Items** [Holly and Mistletoe](/Equipment.aspx?ID=26), [Leather Armor](/Armor.aspx?ID=4), [Rope](/Equipment.aspx?ID=44) (50 feet), [Whip](/Weapons.aspx?ID=48) --- **AC** 20 **Fort** +10 **Ref** +7 **Will** +12 **HP** 54 --- **Speed** 25 feet **Melee** whip +11 ([Disarm](/Traits.aspx?ID=175), [Nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=188), [Reach](/Traits.aspx?ID=192), [Trip](/Traits.aspx?ID=196)), **Damage** 1d4+5 slashing **Primal Prepared Spells** DC 22, attack +14 - **Cantrips (2nd)** [Dancing Lights](/Spells.aspx?ID=58), [Guidance](/Spells.aspx?ID=142), [Produce Flame](/Spells.aspx?ID=236), [Stabilize](/Spells.aspx?ID=307), [Tanglefoot](/Spells.aspx?ID=330) - **1st** [Grease](/Spells.aspx?ID=140), [Jump](/Spells.aspx?ID=167), [Magic Fang](/Spells.aspx?ID=179) - **2nd** [Animal Form](/Spells.aspx?ID=10), [Animal Messenger](/Spells.aspx?ID=11), [Speak with Animals](/Spells.aspx?ID=293) **Druid Order Spells** DC 22, 1 Focus Point - **1st** [Heal Animal](/Spells.aspx?ID=474) **Trained Animal** The beast tamer fights alongside a trained animal ally of its level or lower, most likely a [tiger](/Monsters.aspx?ID=69). The animal has the standard number of actions, uses its normal stat block, and counts toward the encounter's XP budget normally.
The beast tamer can spend 1 action to gain the support benefit appropriate to its [trained animal](/animal-companions). Unlike for an animal companion, this doesn't require the animal to use any of its actions.
